bibl.title: Letter from Carolyn H. Booth to Howard A. Kelly, [19--]

div1.p: Booth writes to Kelly regarding efforts to secure a pension for Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from Carolyn H. Booth to Howard A. Kelly, [19--]

opener.dateline:
138 So Kenilworth
Ave
Oak Park Ill.

div1.p:
On Oct. 14th
I wrote you regarding
Mr Kissinger, and I
regret that my Letter
was lost. I have gained
the complete interest
of Ex Senator Mason
of Illinois (who is again
running for office)
and he assures me
Ac
Ki
that his influence in
certain directions is
strong enough to insure
this pension of $50.00/100.

I wrote you asking
for any added infor-
mation that I could
give Mr Mason about
Mr Kissinger that
he might have a
clear understanding
of the case- A letter
from Mrs Kissinger
this morning gives me
Ac
Ki
some of the items I wanted and
also says that a letter was received
from you recently. All my
letters in regard to Mr Kissinger
I will hand to Mr Mason before
Dec 1st and I only wish I could
do more. I trust Senator
Mason can confer with
Congressman R.L. Brick before
the case comes up-

Trusting that all will
turn out well

closer.signed:
Carolyn H Booth
V.P. for Illinois
